ojc.ahni.integration

Class TargetFitnessFunctionMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • ojc.ahni.integration.BulkFitnessFunctionMT
      • ojc.ahni.integration.TargetFitnessFunctionMT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, java.io.Serializable, BulkFitnessFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestTargetFitnessFunctionNEAT

    public class TargetFitnessFunctionMT
extends BulkFitnessFunctionMT

    Given a set of genotypes that encode a neural network, and a set of training examples consisting of input and target (desired) output pattern pairs, determines fitness based on how close the output of the network encoded by each genome is to the target output given some input.

    Subclasses may wish to override evolutionFinished(ojc.ahni.hyperneat.HyperNEATEvolver) to perform testing or other analysis on the fittest and/or best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run; the method BulkFitnessFunctionMT.generateSubstrate(Chromosome, Activator) may be used to create substrates for a Chromosome.

    Author:
    Oliver Coleman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • ERROR_TYPE_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String ERROR_TYPE_KEY
        The type of error calculation to perform for each input and target output pair. Valid types are:
        • sum: the sum of the differences between each target and actual output value.
        • sum-squared: the sum of the squared differences between each target and actual output value.
        • squared-sum: the squared sum of the differences between each target and actual output value.
        • squared-sum-squared: the squared sum of the squared differences between each target and actual output value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • inputPatterns

        protected double[][] inputPatterns
        Array containing stimuli (input) examples, in the form [trial][input index]. The dimensions should match those of the input layer of the substrate network.

      • targetOutputPatterns

        protected double[][] targetOutputPatterns
        Array containing target (desired output) examples, in the form [trial][input index]. The dimensions should match those of the output layer of the substrate network.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TargetFitnessFunctionMT

        protected TargetFitnessFunctionMT()

      • TargetFitnessFunctionMT

        public TargetFitnessFunctionMT(double[][] inputPatterns,
                       double[][] targetOutputPatterns,
                       double minTargetValue,
                       double maxTargetValue)
        Create a HyperNEATTargetFitnessFunction with the specified input and output examples.
        Parameters:
        inputPatterns - Array containing input patterns, in the form [trial][input index]. The dimensions should match those of the input layer of the substrate network.
        targetOutputPatterns - Array containing target output patterns, in the form [trial][input index]. The dimensions should match those of the output layer of the substrate network.
        minTargetValue - The minimum possible value in the given input patterns.
        maxTargetValue - The maximum possible value in the given target patterns.

      • setMaxFitnessValue

        protected void setMaxFitnessValue(int newMaxFitnessValue)
        Sets the maximum possible fitness value this function will return. Default is 1000000 which is fine for nearly all purposes.
        Parameters:
        newMaxFitnessValue - The new maximum fitness.

      • evaluate

        protected int evaluate(Chromosome genotype,
           Activator substrate,
           int evalThreadIndex)
        Description copied from class: BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Evaluate an individual genotype. This method is called from BulkFitnessFunctionMT.evaluate(List) , and must be overridden in order to evaluate the genotypes.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        genotype - the genotype being evaluated. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.
        substrate - the phenotypic substrate of the genotype being evaluated.
        evalThreadIndex - The index of the evaluator thread. This is not usually required but may be useful in some cases.

      • evolutionFinished

        public void evolutionFinished(HyperNEATEvolver evolver)
        This method is called when an evolutionary run has finished. It can be used to perform testing or other analysis on the fittest and/or best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.

        This default implementation prints out the best performing substrate using its toString() method.

        This default implementation prints out the best performing substrate using its toString() method and the input, target and output patterns for each trial.

        Specified by:
        evolutionFinished in interface BulkFitnessFunction
        Overrides:
        evolutionFinished in class BulkFitnessFunctionMT
        Parameters:
        evolver - Methods on this object can be used to obtain the fittest and best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.
